visa.title: Visa & Entry
visa.subtitle: Visa requirements, customs, health declaration, and entry process.
visa.select_placeholder: -- Select Country (Sorted by Visa Free Status) --
visa.passport_warning: Airlines may refuse boarding if your passport has less than 6 months validity remaining. It is strongly recommended to travel with a passport valid for at least 6 months to avoid being denied entry.
money.title: Money & Mobile Pay
money.subtitle: Setup WeChat/Alipay, currency exchange, and budgeting.
money.wechat_desc: The "Super App". Used for everything from payments to messaging.
money.alipay_desc: Very foreigner-friendly. Built-in translation for mini-apps (Metro, Taxi, etc.).
money.cash_info: While digital is king, keep ~500 RMB cash for emergencies or elderly vendors.
money.cards_info: Visa/Mastercard are rarely accepted directly at stores (except high-end hotels). Link them to Alipay/WeChat instead.
money.exchange_guide: How to Exchange Cash at Banks
transport.title: Transport & Connectivity
transport.subtitle: Trains, Metros, Taxi apps, SIM cards, VPNs, and Wi-Fi.
transport.vpn_warning: Google, WhatsApp, Instagram are blocked. You must install a VPN (e.g., Astrill, LetsVPN) before arrival.
transport.sim_option_a: Option A (Easy): Buy an eSIM (Airalo/Holafly) before flying. Often bypasses firewall.
transport.sim_option_b: Option B (Cheap): Buy a local SIM at the airport (Passport required).
transport.airport_info: Arrive 3 hours early. Power banks must be marked <100Wh.
transport.train_info: Fast (350km/h) and punctual. Passport acts as your ticket.
language.title: Language & Culture
language.subtitle: Essential phrases, translation tools, etiquette, and taboos.
language.google_desc: Requires VPN. Best for live camera translation.
language.iflytek_desc: Local favorite. Extremely accurate for voice/speech translation.
language.wechat_desc: Long-press messages to translate. Scan menus.
language.etiquette.respect: Respect Elders: Use both hands when giving/receiving items (cards, tea).
language.etiquette.table: Table Manners: Tap the table with two fingers to say 'thanks' for tea pouring.
language.etiquette.chopsticks: Chopsticks: Never stick them vertically in rice (resembles funeral incense).
language.etiquette.face: Face: Avoid public confrontation or causing someone to lose face (be polite/indirect).
essentials.title: Essentials & Safety
essentials.subtitle: Insurance, emergency contacts, food safety, scams, and tax refund.
essentials.scam_tea: The Tea House / Art Student Scam: Friendly students ask to practice English and take you to a tea house. You get a bill for $1000+. Solution: Politely decline invitations from strangers on the street.
essentials.scam_taxi: Black Taxis: Unmarked cars at airports. Solution: Use the official taxi queue or Didi app.
essentials.tax_info: International tourists can claim VAT refunds (9%-11%) at designated stores for purchases > 500 RMB.
essentials.food_street: Street Food: Stick to busy stalls with high turnover.
